gui

Class StatePlaying

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.DefaultState
      • gui.StatePlaying
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    State

    public class StatePlaying
extends DefaultState
    Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the third stage where the user plays the game. This class is part of a state pattern for the Controller class. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener (SimpleKeyListener) and then handed over to a Controller object by way of the keyDown method. Responsibilities: Show the first person view and the map view, Accept input for manual operation (left, right, up, down etc), Update the graphics, recognize termination. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Method Detail

      • setMazeConfiguration

        public void setMazeConfiguration(Maze config)
        Description copied from interface: State
        Sets the maze to play, the maze configuration is a container that holds all necessary information about a particular maze that can be played. It is the outcome of the maze generation process performed in the maze factory.
        Specified by:
        setMazeConfiguration in interface State
        Overrides:
        setMazeConfiguration in class DefaultState
        Parameters:
        config - gives a maze to play

      • start

        public void start(Controller controller,
                  MazePanel panel)
        Start the actual game play by showing the playing screen. If the panel is null, all drawing operations are skipped. This mode of operation is useful for testing purposes, i.e., a dryrun of the game without the graphics part.
        Specified by:
        start in interface State
        Overrides:
        start in class DefaultState
        Parameters:
        controller - provides access to the controller this state resides in
        panel - is part of the UI and visible on the screen, needed for drawing

      • startDrawer

        protected void startDrawer()
        Initializes the drawer for the first person view and the map view and then draws the initial screen for this state.

      • setPositionDirectionViewingDirection

        private void setPositionDirectionViewingDirection()
        Internal method to set the current position, the direction and the viewing direction to values consistent with the given maze.

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(Constants.UserInput key,
                       int value)
        Method incorporates all reactions to keyboard input in original code, The simple key listener calls this method to communicate input. Method requires start to be called before.
        Specified by:
        keyDown in interface State
        Overrides:
        keyDown in class DefaultState
        Parameters:
        key - provides the feature the user selected
        value - is not used, exists only for consistency across State classes
        Returns:
        false if not started yet otherwise true

        Parameters:

      • walk

        private void walk(int dir)
        Moves in the given direction with 4 intermediate steps, updates the screen and the internal position
        Parameters:
        dir, - only possible values are 1 (forward) and -1 (backward)

        Parameters:
